item.title: Research
item.description: My research revolves around issues on the accumulation of human capital and the functioning of labor markets in low and middle income countries. I am also interested in methodological aspects of policy evaluation, and in particular in combining model-based and design-based approaches. Working Papers Enhancing Human Capital in Children. A Case Study on Scaling (with F. Agostinelli and C. Avitabile). Revise and Resubmit (third round), Journal of Political Economy. VoxDev.

I am a Professor of Economics at the Toulouse School of Economics (TSE) in France. Prior to my academic career, I have been an Economist at the Inter-American Development Bank in Washington DC. I am a Research Fellow at the CEPR (Development and Labor), IZA, and EUDN. I am also an invited researcher at J-PAL (Learning for All Initiative and Latin America Office). I can be reached at matteo.bobba@tse-fr.eu. My most recent CV is here.
